value.label: exploration licence
value.definition: Permit to manage prospecting and exploration works on restricted area.

value.label: protected deposit area
value.definition: Area restricted by the territorial decission ensuring a deposit against actions rendering its mining difficult or impossible (i.e. the fully official decission about land utilization).

value.label: mining area (leases)
value.definition: Area with mining permit.

register.label: Minerals Intelligence Network for Europe register

value.label: public - state
value.definition: Deposit (mineral) owned by state.

value.label: public - regional
value.definition: Deposit (mineral) owned by territorial entity of state.

value.label: private
value.definition: Deposit owned by landowner.

register.label: Minerals Intelligence Network for Europe register

codelist.label: International trade statistics
codelist.definition: Mineral raw material international trade statistics registered after common custom codes (after Commission Regulation (EC) no 1214/2007 (Sections and CN)).

register.label: Minerals Intelligence Network for Europe register

value.label: V. Mineral products
value.definition: Mineral products

value.label: Salt; sulphur; earths and stone...
value.definition: Salt; sulphur; earths and stone; plastering materials, lime and cement. CN: 2501-2530

value.label: Ores, slag and ash
value.definition: Ores, slag and ash. CN: 2601-2620

value.label: Mineral fuels, mineral oils ..
value.definition: Mineral fuels, mineral oils and products of their distillation; bituminous substances; mineral waxes. CN: 2701-2715

value.label: VI - Products of the chemical....
value.definition: Products of the chemical or allied industries

value.label: Inorganic chemicals;.. rare-earth metals…
value.definition: Inorganic chemicals; organic or inorganic compounds of precious metals, of rare-earth metals, of radioactive elements or of isotopes. CN: 280530, 2846

value.label: XIV - Precious stones ...
value.definition: Natural or cultured pearls, precious or semi-precious stones, precious metals, metals clad with precious metal, and articles thereof; imitation jewellery; coins.

value.label: Precious stones ...
value.definition: Natural or cultured pearls, precious or semi-precious stones, precious metals, metals clad with precious metal, and articles thereof; imitation jewellery; coins. CN: 7102-7103, 7106, 7108, 7110

value.label: XV - Base metals…
value.definition: Base metals and articles of base metal.

value.label: Iron and steel
value.definition: Iron and steel. CN: 7201-7202

value.label: Copper and articles
value.definition: Copper and articles thereof. CN: 7401-7404

value.label: Nickel and articles
value.definition: Nickel and articles thereof. CN: 7501-7503

value.label: Aluminium and articles
value.definition: Aluminium and articles thereof. CN: 7601-7602

value.label: Lead and articles
value.definition: Lead and articles thereof. CN: 7801-7802

value.label: Zinc and articles
value.definition: Zinc and articles thereof. CN: 7901-7902

value.label: Tin and articles
value.definition: Tin and articles thereof. CN: 8001-8002

value.label: Other base metals; cermets; articles
value.definition: Other base metals; cermets; articles thereof. CN: 8101-8113

codelist.label: Critical raw materials
codelist.definition: CRM - Economically important mineral raw materials identified by the European Commission, which have higher risks of supply interruption due to the potential growth in demand.

value.label: antimony
value.definition: Antimony (metal)

value.label: beryllium
value.definition: Beryllium (BeO)

value.label: cobalt
value.definition: Cobalt (metal)

value.label: fluorspar
value.definition: Fluorite or Fluospar (CaF2)

value.label: gallium
value.definition: Gallium (metal)

value.label: germanium
value.definition: Germanium (metal)

value.label: graphite
value.definition: Graphite (substance)

value.label: indium
value.definition: Indium (metal)

value.label: magnesium
value.definition: Magnesium, magnesite (MgCO3)

value.label: niobium
value.definition: Niobium - columbium (Nb2O5)

value.label: platinum group metals
value.definition: Platinum group elements (PGE), group (metal)

value.definition: Tantalum (Ta2O5)

codelist.label: Enduse Potential
codelist.definition: Values indicating the end-use potential of the mineral.
codelist.description: <font color="#211d1e">EXAMPLE: </font>for energy, fertilizer, building raw material etc.\n<font color="#211d1e">\n</font>

value.label: metallic minerals
value.definition: Mineral occurrences including any type of metallic mineral.

value.label: precious metals
value.definition: Mineral occurrences including Silver; Gold; Platinoids in general.

value.label: base metals
value.definition: Mineral occurrences including Aluminium; Copper; Lead; Lead + Zinc; Tin; Zinc

value.label: iron and ferro-alloy metals
value.definition: Mineral occurrences including Cobalt; Chromium; Iron; Manganese; Molybdenum; Niobium; Nickel; Vanadium; Tungsten.

value.label: speciality and rare metals
value.definition: Mineral occurrences including Beryllium; Bismuth; Cadmium; Germanium, Gallium; Hafnium; Mercury; Indium; Lithium; Rubidium, Cesium; Rhenium; Rare Earths (undifferentiated); Antimony; Selenium; Tantalum; Tellurium; Titanium (ilmenite, rutile); Zirconium (zircon, baddeleyite).

value.label: non-metallic minerals
value.definition: Mineral occurrences including any type of non-metallic mineral.

value.label: building raw material
value.definition: Mineral occurrences including Aggregate; Dimension & ornamental stones (granite, gabbro, travertine,etc.); Gypsum, anhydrite; Cement limestone; Limestone for lime; Marble.

value.label: ceramic and refractory
value.definition: Mineral occurrences including common clays (brick, tile); White-firing clays (refractory and ceramic clays); Dolomite; Feldspar, nepheline; Kaolin; Andalusite group (andalusite, kyanite, sillimanite).

value.label: chemical minerals
value.definition: Mineral occurrences including Borates; Barite; Fluorite; Magnesium (magnesite); Sodium sulphate; Sodium carbonate (trona); Pyrite; Sulphur; Rock salt; Strontium; Zeolites.

value.label: energy cover minerals
value.definition: Mineral occurrences including Bituminous sandstone/limestone, oil shale; Coal; Lignite; Peat; Thorium; Uranium.

value.label: fertilizer
value.definition: Mineral occurrences including Phosphate; Potash (sylvite, carnalite).

value.label: precious and semi-precious stones
value.definition: Mineral occurrences including Diamond (industrial and gemstone); Emerald; Ruby, Sapphire, Corundum (gemstone); Beryls, quartz, tourmalines, garnets, topaz, peridot, zircon, etc. (gemstones).

value.label: speciality and other industrial rocks and minerals
value.definition: Mineral occurrences including Abrasives: garnet, staurolite, corundum; Asbestos (antophyllite, chrysotile, crocidolite); Attapulgite, sepiolite (clay); Bentonite (clay); Limestone, calcite (filler); Diatomite (kieselguhr); Graphite; Mica; Perlite; Quartz (massive / block for ferrosilicon); Quartz, optical & piezoelectrical use; Silica sand; Talc, pyrophyllite; Vermiculite; Wollastonite.

value.label: recycled waste
value.definition: Mineral occurrences including metals or minerals coming from mining waste treatment.

codelist.label: Exploration Activity Type
codelist.definition: Types of exploration activity carried out.

value.label: regional reconnaissance
value.definition: Regional investigation to identify anomalies (geochemical, geophysical, mineralogical) and discover occurrences.

value.label: detailed surface exploration
value.definition: Detailed surface exploration to delineate anomalies and describe occurrences in their refined geological context.

value.label: subsurface exploration
value.definition: Subsurface exploration using the low costs techniques (trenching, destructive drilling, etc.), of resources appraisal.

value.label: assesment of the resource
value.definition: The aim of this phase is the (still rough) delineation of the envelope of an orebody. Logging of cores, sampling of mineralized sections to better understand the distinctive features of the deposit, the physical properties of the ore, and finally to lead to a first (still approximate) calculation of the resource.

value.label: evaluation of the ore deposit
value.definition: This the final phase of evaluation leading to the final yes/no mining decision.

codelist.label: Mining Activity Type
codelist.definition: The type of mining activity, processing activity, or production.

value.label: adit
value.definition: A horizontal passage from the surface into a mine.

value.label: alluvial
value.definition: Said of a placer formed by the action of running water, as in a stream channel or alluvial fan; also, said of the valuable mineral, e.g. gold or diamond, associated with an alluvial placer.

value.label: decline
value.definition: Passage or adit driven on a decline from the surface to provide access to a mine.

value.label: diggings
value.definition: A term applied in the western U.S. to diggings for gold or other precious minerals located on a bar or in the shallows of a stream, and worked when the water is low.

value.label: dredging
value.definition: A form of open pit mining in which the digging machinery and processing plant are situated on a floating barge or hull.

value.label: multiple
value.definition: A multiple activity.

value.label: open pit
value.definition: An open-sky excavation (also open-sky mine) for the extraction of metallic ores and /or commodities.

value.label: open pit and underground
value.definition: Covers both the open pit and underground mining activity.

value.label: quarry
value.definition: Open workings, usually for the extraction of stone.

value.label: reworking
value.definition: New mining activities carried out on already explored mines.

value.label: shaft
value.definition: A vertical or inclined excavation through which a mine is worked.

value.label: sluicing
value.definition: Concentrating heavy minerals, e.g., gold or cassiterite, by washing unconsolidated material through boxes (sluices) equipped with riffles that trap the heavier minerals on the floor of the box.

value.label: solution mining
value.definition: (a) The in-place dissolution of water-soluble mineral components of an ore deposit by permitting a leaching solution, usually aqueous, to trickle downward through the fractured ore to collection galleries at depth. b) The mining of soluble rock material, esp. salt, from underground deposits by pumping water down wells into contact with the deposit and removing the artificial brine thus created.

value.label: surface mining
value.definition: Broad category of mining in which soil and rock overlying the mineral deposit (the overburden) are removed.

value.label: surface mining and underground
value.definition: Covers both surface and underground mining.

value.label: underground
value.definition: An underground excavation for the extraction of mineral deposits, in contrast to surface excavations

codelist.label: Mine Status
codelist.definition: Values indicating the operational status of the mine.

value.label: operating
value.definition: A mine is operating.

value.label: operating continuously
value.definition: A mine is operating continuously.

value.label: operating intermittently
value.definition: A mine is operating intermittently.

value.label: not operating
value.definition: A mine is not operating.

value.label: closed
value.definition: A mine can be closed for technical, economical or technico-economical reasons.

value.label: abandoned
value.definition: A mine is abandoned.

value.label: care and maintenance
value.definition: A mine is under care and maintenance.

value.label: retention
value.definition: A mine can be kept unexploited until the price of contained commodity(ies) makes it economical.

value.label: historic
value.definition: An 'old' mine which has been exploited before 1900.

value.label: under development
value.definition: Under development.

value.label: under construction
value.definition: Under construction.

value.label: pending approval
value.definition: A mine waiting for the exploitation authorization, generally given by a State Mining Engineering Department.

value.label: feasibility
value.definition: Technical economic study aimed at assessing the possibility to launching a mine venture.

value.label: mineral deposit
value.definition: A mass of naturally occurring mineral material, e.g. metal ores or non-metallic minerals, usually of economic value, without regard to mode of origin. Accumulations of coal and petroleum may or may not be included.

value.label: ore deposit
value.definition: The naturally occurring material from which a mineral or minerals of economic value can be extracted at a reasonable profit.

value.label: occurrence
value.definition: Any ore or economic mineral in any concentration found in bedrock or as float.

value.label: prospect
value.definition: An area that is a potential site of mineral deposits, based on preliminary exploration, previous exploration. A geologic or geophysical anomaly, especially one recommended for additional exploration.

value.label: province
value.definition: Geologic provinces classified by mineral resources.

value.label: district
value.definition: Geologic districts classified by mineral resources.

value.label: field
value.definition: A region or area that possesses or is characterized by a particular mineral resource.

value.label: lode
value.definition: A mineral deposit consisting of a zone of veins, veinlets, disseminations, or planar breccias.

codelist.label: Processing Activity Type
codelist.definition: Values indicating the type of processing carried out during a mining activity.

value.label: physical treatment
value.definition: Sorting process using physical separation methods. physicalChemicalTreatment

value.label: physical chemical treatment
value.definition: Sorting process combining physical and chemical separation methods.

value.label: chemical treatment
value.definition: Sorting process using chemical separation methods.unknownTreatment

value.label: unknown treatment
value.definition: Sorting process - treatment is unknown.

codelist.label: Reserve Category
codelist.definition: The level of confidence of the estimate of the reserve.

value.label: proved ore reserves
value.definition: A ‘Proved Ore Reserve’ is the economically mineable part of a Measured Mineral Resource. It includes diluting materials and allowances for losses which may occur when the material is mined.

value.label: probable ore reserves
value.definition: A ‘Probable Ore Reserve’ is the economically mineable part of an Indicated, and in some circumstances, a measured mineral resource. It includes diluting materials and allowances for losses which may occur when the material is mined.

value.label: proved and probable ore reserves
value.definition: Covers both the Proved Ore Reserves and Probable Ore Reserves.inaccessibleDocumentation

value.label: inaccessible documentation
value.definition: Ore reserve without any accessible documentation.

value.label: national reserve reporting code
value.definition: Definitions of national mineral reserve classification code categories and groups.

codelist.label: Resource Category
codelist.definition: Indication whether the resource is measured, indicated or inferred.

value.label: measured mineral resource
value.definition: The part of a Mineral Resource for which tonnage, densities, shape, physical characteristics, grade and mineral content can be estimated with a high level of confidence.

value.label: indicated mineral resource
value.definition: The part of a Mineral Resource for which tonnage, densities, shape, physical characteristics, grade and mineral content can be estimated with a reasonable level of confidence.

value.label: inferred mineral resource
value.definition: The part of a Mineral Resource for which tonnage, grade and mineral content can be estimated with a low level of confidence. It is inferred from geological evidence and assumed but not verified geological and/or grade continuity.

value.label: measured and indicated mineral resource
value.definition: A combination of measured mineral resource and indicated mineral resource.

value.label: measured, indicated and inferred mineral resource
value.definition: A combination of measured mineral resource, indicated mineral resource and inferred mineral resource.

value.label: indicated and inferred mineral resource
value.definition: A combination of indicated mineral resource and inferred mineral resource.

value.label: poorly documented
value.definition: Poorly estimated or documented mineral resource.

value.label: national resource reporting code
value.definition: Definitions of national mineral resource classification code categories and groups.
